data.text: @HibbertMatthew Central Museums should keep foreign items and national items that cannot be locally displayed but not suck in all national items. The once great Sutton Hoo centre is full of cardboard cut-out men, and description boards. You could buy anything on display there with a £5 note.

@EALTurner Yes, I agree.  I first wen to the British Museum about 15 years ago, and got to say that it was very cold.  And the Egyptian stuff was so much better in Egypt (though probably not as well organised!)

@HibbertMatthew It's not the first time something like this has happened. The Museum in Baghdad after the US invasion was ransacked. Regional museums in Syria must have suffered the same fate. British museum displays are totally cold too, devoid of the context of the culture that produced it.
@EALTurner Good point: it's running a very big risk, isn't it.
